github.copilot.chat.commitMessageGenerat.text: Use the Conventional Commits format: <type>[optional scope]: <gitmoji> <imperative description>
Allowed types: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, chore, ci
Common scopes: api, ui, auth, config, deps, tests, ci, docs, core, utils
Use imperative mood in the subject line: 'Add feature' not 'Added feature'
Keep subject line concise: under 50 characters, no trailing period
Use an appropriate gitmoji to enhance readability (e.g., ‚ú®, üêõ, üîß, üìù)
Include a scope in parentheses if relevant (e.g., api, ui, auth)
For breaking changes: Add '!' after type/scope and 'BREAKING CHANGE:' in body
Add an optional body with bullet points for context or motivation
Reference issues using syntax like: Refs #123 or Closes #456
Example: feat(api): ‚ú® Add JWT token authentication
Example: fix(ui): üêõ Fix button alignment on mobile
Example: refactor(auth): üî® Simplify token refresh logic

Example with body: feat(auth): ‚ú® Add OAuth2 support

- Implement Google OAuth2 provider
- Add user session management
- Update security policies

Closes #123
